attributes.text:
Behavior to support pre-rendering of invisible areas of a virtual scroller. If applied to a scroller it will start a timer and increase the rendered area of the scroller after a certain period of time. Subsequent scrolling will not have to render this pre-computed area again.

EXPERIMENTAL!
The scroller to prefetch

This map contains minimum and maximum pixels to prefetch near the view port.

  • minLeft: minimim pixels to prefetch left to the view port
  • maxLeft: maximum pixels to prefetch left to the view port
  • minRight: minimim pixels to prefetch right to the view port
  • maxRight: maximum pixels to prefetch right to the view port
  • minAbove: minimim pixels to prefetch above the view port
  • maxAbove: maximum pixels to prefetch above the view port
  • minBelow: minimim pixels to prefetch below the view port
  • maxBelow: maximum pixels to prefetch below the view port
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property interval.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property scroller.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scroller}.
Update prefetching

Returns the (computed) value of the property interval.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.
(Computed) value of interval.

Returns the (computed) value of the property scroller.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scroller}.
(Computed) value of scroller.
Initial value for property interval.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property interval with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.
the default value
Initial value for property scroller.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property scroller with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scroller}.
the default value

Resets the user value of the property interval.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.

Resets the user value of the property scroller.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scroller}.
New value for property interval.

Sets the user value of the property interval.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #interval}.
The unmodified incoming value.
